Text.Value: What's even through there?
Hmm. Perhaps I should do just that.
The rules apply, same as before. No entry without express permission.
Nobody's allowed through here without permission... even you.
You may enter.
Hands to yourself. What's through there isn't for you - not without permission.
If you insist on standing on ceremony, soon you won't be standing at all. Got it?
I've already gotten permission - go speak to the attendant if you don't believe me.
But it is not for you. Not yet.
Got it. In you go - just don't cause any trouble.
Chosen you may be, but I have my duty. The door stays shut until you have permission.
You're eager - good. But there is a right order to things - before you can enter, you must agree to the House of Grief's terms - and price.
You can trust my loyalty, m'lady. The Nightsinger has chosen you.
Let's not get tangled up in bureaucracy, shall we? Easier to just let me pass.
I wouldn't be standing here if you were allowed to pass.
Then it should be remarkably easy for you to obtain the correct permissions. See to that, and I will be out of your way.
M'lady. An honour to serve you.
The writing's on the wall... along with a fair bit of blood, I suspect. You'll get no trouble from me.
Easier for who? You? Afraid not, friend. You enter by the book, or not at all.
Threats, is it? Whatever you think you know about this place is irrelevant. The door stays shut until you have permission.
You can drop the act, brother. We both know what this place truly is. Let me pass.
Threats, is it? You truly do need our help, friend - but on our terms. There's nothing more to be said until you have permission.
I... I didn't realise. Apologies, please enter.
It doesn't matter what you think you know about this place friend. All that matters is having permission - which you're lacking.
I've no quarrel with you. None at all.
Enough. We both know what this place truly is, and who is worshipped here. Let me pass.
Speak to the attendant by the front. She will put everything in order for you. Then you will be free to enter.
Like I said. You need permission to go any farther.
Nobody's allowed through here without permission... least of all you.
Leave.
I know what this place is. Stand aside, or you soon won't be standing at all.
Go on, inside.
And leave my posted unmanned in the meanwhile? No. You can enter on our terms, or not at all.
Fine. I'll bend the rules this once - in the interest of charity. In you go.
We both know who is truly worshipped here. I am her chosen warrior. Stand aside, or feel her wrath.
You seem to recall my face. Likely you'll know I'm expected.
That is where the Mapping of the Heart takes place - where all who seek to be unburdened open themselves up and lay their wounds and sorrows bare.
Fine - just remember that what happens through those doors and beyond is secret. On you go.
All right, enter. Just don't cause trouble, and keep our secrets secret.

Synopsis: A guard at the House of Grief. He stands sentry at the door leading to the Mapping room.
